title: Red Sox have reportedly discussed trading reliever Jordan Hicks in search of an infielder
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Red Sox are in trade talks to potentially trade reliever Jordan Hicks for an infielder.
Starters Brayan Bello and Patrick Sandoval are also being discussed in potential trades for infield help.
Infielders linked to Red Sox include Nico Hoerner, Matt Shaw, Isaac Paredes, and free agent Eugenio Suarez.

title: Breakout Patriots LB K’Lavon Chaisson wants to re-sign with New England in free agency
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Patriots linebacker K'Lavon Chaisson aims to re-sign with New England after a standout year in free agency.
Chaisson recorded 7.5 sacks, 18 QB hits, and two forced fumbles during the regular season with the Patriots.
Chaisson credits offensive and defensive coordinators for his success and expresses desire to win Super Bowl LX.

title: Patriots DC Terrell Williams declared cancer-free after four months battling prostate cancer
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Patriots Defensive Coordinator Terrell Williams is cancer-free after a prostate cancer diagnosis in September.
Williams underwent five rounds of chemotherapy at Mass General Hospital over four months.
Head coach Mike Vrabel announced Williams will join the Patriots traveling to Santa Clara for Super Bowl LX.

title: Cambridge becomes first Mass. city to endorse Plant Based Treaty — but what does that mean?
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Cambridge becomes the first Massachusetts city to endorse the Plant Based Treaty, aiming to reduce greenhouse gas emissions.
The city is the 66th globally to support the treaty, which complements the Paris Agreement for a sustainable food system.
Local officials and residents discuss benefits of plant-based diets, emphasizing health, environmental impact, and food policy improvements.

title: 5 Catherine O’Hara movies and TV shows streaming right now
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Catherine O'Hara, Emmy-winning star of 'Schitt's Creek', died at 71 after a brief illness.
O'Hara began her career at Second City in Toronto, collaborating with comedy legends like Eugene Levy.
Notable streaming performances include 'Schitt's Creek' on Hulu/Prime Video and 'A Mighty Wind' on YouTube.

title: Mike Vrabel doesn’t buy that Patriots’ white uniforms provide good luck: ‘Hope the tooth fairy comes tonight’
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots' head coach Mike Vrabel dismisses superstition about uniform colors impacting game outcomes.
Patriots have chosen white uniforms for Super Bowl LX against the Seahawks, maintaining a 5-0 record this season in white.
Historically, teams wearing white in the Super Bowl have a favorable 37-22 record, but recent wins by home jerseys add complexity.

title: Dave Epstein on how this Atlantic winter storm will impact Mass. — and how it largely won’t
author: David Epstein
bullets: Cape Cod and the Islands will see the most impact from the nor'easter, with 3-6 inches of snow expected.
The storm will bring 1-3 inches of snow to the South Shore and Rhode Island, and less than an inch in Boston.
Coastal flooding is possible Sunday and Monday due to strong winds and a 1-3 foot storm surge during high tides.

title: Celtics reportedly unlikely to take ‘huge swings’ ahead of NBA trade deadline
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Celtics unlikely to pursue major trades before Feb. 5 deadline, per ESPN report by Tim Bontemps and Brian Windhorst.
Boston might consider trading Anfernee Simons, who earns $27.7M in the last year of his contract, to match salaries.
Jayson Tatum's potential return from injury could impact Celtics' trade decisions more than acquiring new players.

title: These 5 Boston restaurants received all-alcohol licenses under new legislation
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: Five Boston restaurants upgraded to all-alcohol licenses under new city legislation approved by the Boston Licensing Board.
The provision in the Massachusetts State Budget allows exchanging beer-and-wine licenses for all-alcohol licenses.
Approved restaurants include 89 Charles, Bebop, Carmelina’s, New England Wicked Craft Company, and Serafina.

title: Entangled right whale found dead off North Carolina coast
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: NOAA confirms the death of a 4-year-old North Atlantic right whale entangled in fishing gear off North Carolina.
The whale, known as 'Division', was identified by its unique callosity pattern and was last seen alive on January 21.
Division's death is the first North Atlantic right whale fatality since May 2024; federal authorities are analyzing the fishing gear.
